tp:docstring.p: Derived from interface Text, EditableText provides methods for modifying textual content of components which support editing. EditableText also interacts with the system clipboard via copyText, cutText, and pasteText.

Read-only instances of EditableText are possible; These may be instances of a general-purpose component type which are sometimes, but not always, user-editable, or may be components which are temporarily or circumstantially in a non-editable state.
Replace the text contents with a new string, discarding the old contents.

arg.name: newContents
arg.tp:docstring: A UTF-8 string with which the text object's contents will be replaced.
True if the text content was successfully changed, False otherwise.

tp:docstring.p: Insert new text contents into an existing text object at a given location, while retaining the old contents.

arg.name: position
arg.tp:docstring: The character offset into the Text implementor's content at which the new content will be inserted.

arg.name: text
arg.tp:docstring: A UTF-8 string of which length characters will be inserted into the text object's text buffer.

arg.name: length
arg.tp:docstring: The number of characters of text to insert. If the character count of text is less than or equal to length, the entire contents of text will be inserted.
True if the text content was successfully inserted, False otherwise.

tp:docstring.p: Apply a particular set of attributes to a range of text.

arg.tp:docstring: True if the text attributes were successfully modified, False otherwise.

tp:docstring.p: Copy a range of text into the system clipboard.

arg.name: startPos
arg.tp:docstring: The character offset of the first character in the range of text being copied.

arg.name: endPos
arg.tp:docstring: The offset of the first character past the end of the range of text being copied.

tp:docstring.p: Excise a range of text from a Text object, copying it into the system clipboard.

arg.name: startPos
arg.tp:docstring: The character offset of the first character in the range of text being cut.

arg.name: endPos
arg.tp:docstring: The offset of the first character past the end of the range of text being cut.
True if the text was successfully cut, False otherwise.

tp:docstring.p: Excise a range of text from a Text object without copying it into the system clipboard.

arg.name: startPos
arg.tp:docstring: The character offset of the first character in the range of text being deleted.

arg.name: endPos
arg.tp:docstring: The offset of the first character past the end of the range of text being deleted.
True if the text was successfully deleted, False otherwise.

tp:docstring.p: Copy the text contents of the system clipboard, if any, into a Text object, inserting it at a particular character offset.
The character offset before which the text will be inserted.

arg.tp:docstring: True if the text was successfully pasted into the Text object, False otherwise.
